title: How to Make Kahlua and Coffee

steps.headline: Fill a serving glass with ice.
steps.description: Use a glass that can hold at least 1 cup (240 ml) of liquid. You can use crushed or cubed ice.

steps.headline: Pour iced coffee over the ice.
steps.description: Measure 2/3 cup (160 ml) of cold coffee and pour it over the ice. You can use brewed coffee that you've chilled or cold-brewed coffee.

steps.headline: Stir in Kahlua and serve the drink.
steps.description: Measure 1/3 cup (80 ml) of Kahlua and pour it over the iced coffee. Use a spoon or straw to stir the drink so the Kahlua is distributed. Drink the iced Kahlua coffee immediately.

steps.headline: Brew a cup of coffee.
steps.description: Use your favorite brewing method to make 1 cup (240 ml) of hot coffee. For example, make a French press, use a drip coffee maker, or use a Chemex or Moka pot.

steps.headline: Pour the Kahlua and any cream or sweeteners into a mug.
steps.description: Get out your serving mug and measure 1 ounce (30 ml) of Kahlua into it. If you'd like to make a creamier coffee, add a few splashes of milk, cream, or half and half. If you'd like your coffee to be sweeter, add as much sugar as you like. You can also use your favorite sweetened coffee creamer in place of the cream and sugar.

steps.headline: Stir in the brewed coffee.
steps.description: Slowly pour in the hot coffee until the mug is full. Use a spoon to stir the drink. Taste the coffee and adjust any of the flavors. Enjoy the Kahlua coffee while it's still hot.

steps.headline: Place 1 cup (140 g) of ice in a serving glass.
steps.description: The serving glass should be large enough to hold 1 1/3 cups (314 ml) of liquid. You can use ice cubes or crushed ice.

steps.headline: Measure the Kahlua, espresso, sugar, and milk into the glass.
steps.description: Measure 1 ounce (30 ml) of Kahlua and 1 ounce (30 ml) of espresso into the glass. Add 2 teaspoons (2 g) of turbinado sugar and 1 cup (240 ml) of milk. You can make your own espresso, buy an espresso shot, or even use instant espresso powder in a pinch.

steps.headline: Stir and taste the Iced Kahlua Americano.
steps.description: Use a spoon to stir the drink and taste it, so you can adjust the flavorings. Stir in extra turbinado sugar, if you'd like it to be sweeter. Or you can stir in extra milk to make a creamier drink. Serve the drink immediately.

steps.headline: Brew a cup of coffee.
steps.description: Use your favorite brewing method to make 1 cup (240 ml) of hot coffee. For example, you can make coffee with a Moka Pot, Chemex, drip coffee maker, or French press.

steps.headline: Place brown sugar in a serving glass.
steps.description: Measure 1 tablespoon (12.5 g) of brown sugar into an Irish coffee glass. If you don't have an Irish coffee glass, you can use a standard mug.

steps.headline: Add the Irish cream and Kahlua to the glass.
steps.description: Pour 3 tablespoons (45 ml) of Irish cream and 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of Kahlua coffee liquor into the glass.

steps.headline: Stir in the hot coffee.
steps.description: Slowly pour in the cup of hot coffee. Stir the drink until the liqueurs are incorporated.

steps.headline: Top the drink with whipped cream and serve it.
steps.description: Dollop 2 tablespoons (6 g) of fresh whipped cream on top of the Kahlua Irish coffee. Sip the drink while it's still hot.

text: Making Iced Kahlua Coffee Fill a serving glass with ice. Use a glass that can hold at least 1 cup (240 ml) of liquid. You can use crushed or cubed ice. Pour iced coffee over the ice. Measure 2/3 cup (160 ml) of cold coffee and pour it over the ice. You can use brewed coffee that you've chilled or cold-brewed coffee. Stir in Kahlua and serve the drink. Measure 1/3 cup (80 ml) of Kahlua and pour it over the iced coffee. Use a spoon or straw to stir the drink so the Kahlua is distributed. Drink the iced Kahlua coffee immediately. Making Hot Kahlua Coffee Brew a cup of coffee. Use your favorite brewing method to make 1 cup (240 ml) of hot coffee. For example, make a French press, use a drip coffee maker, or use a Chemex or Moka pot. Pour the Kahlua and any cream or sweeteners into a mug. Get out your serving mug and measure 1 ounce (30 ml) of Kahlua into it. If you'd like to make a creamier coffee, add a few splashes of milk, cream, or half and half. If you'd like your coffee to be sweeter, add as much sugar as you like. You can also use your favorite sweetened coffee creamer in place of the cream and sugar. Stir in the brewed coffee. Slowly pour in the hot coffee until the mug is full. Use a spoon to stir the drink. Taste the coffee and adjust any of the flavors. Enjoy the Kahlua coffee while it's still hot. Making Iced Kahlua Americano Place 1 cup (140 g) of ice in a serving glass. The serving glass should be large enough to hold 1 1/3 cups (314 ml) of liquid. You can use ice cubes or crushed ice. Measure the Kahlua, espresso, sugar, and milk into the glass. Measure 1 ounce (30 ml) of Kahlua and 1 ounce (30 ml) of espresso into the glass. Add 2 teaspoons (2 g) of turbinado sugar and 1 cup (240 ml) of milk. You can make your own espresso, buy an espresso shot, or even use instant espresso powder in a pinch. Stir and taste the Iced Kahlua Americano. Use a spoon to stir the drink and taste it, so you can adjust the flavorings. Stir in extra turbinado sugar, if you'd like it to be sweeter. Or you can stir in extra milk to make a creamier drink. Serve the drink immediately. Making Kahlua Irish Coffee Brew a cup of coffee. Use your favorite brewing method to make 1 cup (240 ml) of hot coffee. For example, you can make coffee with a Moka Pot, Chemex, drip coffee maker, or French press. Place brown sugar in a serving glass. Measure 1 tablespoon (12.5 g) of brown sugar into an Irish coffee glass. If you don't have an Irish coffee glass, you can use a standard mug. Add the Irish cream and Kahlua to the glass. Pour 3 tablespoons (45 ml) of Irish cream and 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of Kahlua coffee liquor into the glass. Stir in the hot coffee. Slowly pour in the cup of hot coffee. Stir the drink until the liqueurs are incorporated. Top the drink with whipped cream and serve it. Dollop 2 tablespoons (6 g) of fresh whipped cream on top of the Kahlua Irish coffee. Sip the drink while it's still hot.
